main.name: David Ward
main.description: Full stack software developer, IEEE published author, and driven self starter
main.bio: I love technology because there's practically no limit on what helpful tools you can create, besides one's patience! Luckily, I love learning about complex systems and troubleshooting them. During my free time, I'm either eating at my favorite restaurants in Los Angeles or trying to figure out how to automate my blinds with microcontrollers.
main.contactmessage: Please reach out to me through LinkedIn (in/DavidMacotoWard) or email me at DavidMacotoWard@gmail.com.

resume.skillmessage: Specalties: Full stack with Ruby on Rails Framework, data analysis using Python, and technical writing.

education.description: Spear headed structural bioinformatics and paid computational research projects during senior year, participated in two hackathons, won 2019 AI Jam (team), and was the project manager, web developer, data preprocessing engineer, and primary author of senior design research paper, which was later published in the 2022 IEEE ICMLA Conference proceeding.

work.title: Full stack web developer
work.description: Sole web developer for monolithic social media app. Enabled quick public launch of small startup by independently shipping 27 bug and features updates with automated branch testing (66 unit and 131 integration tests). Used Ruby on Rails, Stimulus.js/Hotwire, PostgreSQL, ActiveRecord, and AWS.

work.title: Full Stack Web Developer
work.description: Created Novel research analysis web app that conglomerates and standardizes protein domain data from multiple sources. Used C#, .NET Core, Entity Framework, Angular.ts, MariaSQL, and Apache server.

research.title: Data analyst, web developer, project manager, major contributing writer
research.description: Senior group research project predicted wildfires in California using machine learning and raw geospatial data with 93% accuracy.
